poses.title: Adho Mukha Svanasana
description: Start in a tabletop position: hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Spread your fingers wide and press palms firmly into the mat.
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground.
Straighten your legs and push your hips up and back, forming an inverted 'V'.
Keep your head relaxed and look toward your thighs.
Press your heels toward the ground, even if they donâ€™t touch the floor.
Hold for 5-10 breaths.

poses.title: Bhujangasana
description: Lie on your stomach with your legs extended and toes pointing back.
Place your palms under your shoulders with elbows close to your body.
Inhale, press into your palms, and lift your chest off the mat.
Keep your shoulders down and elbows slightly bent.
Gaze upward without straining your neck.
Hold for 15-30 seconds, breathing evenly.

poses.title: Halasana
description: Lie on your back with arms by your sides.
Inhale, lift your legs to 90 degrees, and exhale as you roll your hips off the floor.
Support your back with your hands and lower your legs over your head.
Try to touch your toes to the floor behind you.
Keep your neck relaxed and breathe deeply for 15-30 seconds.

poses.title: Matsyasana
description: Lie on your back with your legs together and hands under your thighs.
Inhale, arch your back, and lift your chest upward.
Rest the top of your head on the mat.
Keep your weight on your forearms and head, not your neck.
Hold for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Trikonasana
description: Stand with feet wide apart, turning your right foot out and left foot slightly inward.
Extend arms at shoulder height.
Bend sideways from the hip, reaching your right hand to your shin or ankle.
Stretch your left arm upward and gaze toward your left hand.
Hold for 10-15 breaths, then switch sides.

poses.title: Balasana
description: Sit on your heels with knees slightly apart.
Stretch your arms forward and lower your forehead to the mat.
Relax your back and shoulders.
Hold for 30 seconds while breathing deeply.

poses.title: Padmasana
description: Sit cross-legged, placing each foot on the opposite thigh.
Rest your hands on your knees with palms facing upward.
Straighten your back and close your eyes.
Breathe deeply and steadily for 1-2 minutes.

poses.title: Tadasana
description: Stand tall with feet together, shoulders relaxed.
Interlock your fingers and stretch your arms overhead.
Lift your heels off the floor and balance on your toes.
Hold for 10-15 breaths while stretching upward.

poses.title: Parivrtta Utkatasana
description: Stand with feet together, then bend your knees as if sitting in a chair.
Bring your palms together at your chest in a prayer position.
Twist your torso to the right, hooking your left elbow on the outside of your right knee.
Hold for 15-30 seconds, then switch sides.

poses.title: Supta Baddha Konasana
description: Lie on your back with soles of your feet together and knees falling apart.
Place hands on your belly or stretch them out to the sides.
Relax and hold the pose for 1-2 minutes.

poses.title: Kapalabhati Pranayama
description: Sit comfortably with your spine straight.
Take a deep inhale and exhale forcefully through your nose while contracting your abdomen.
Keep your inhales passive and focus on sharp, rhythmic exhales.
Repeat for 1-2 minutes.

poses.title: Ustrasana
description: Kneel on the mat with knees hip-width apart.
Place hands on your lower back or reach for your heels.
Inhale, arch your back, and push your hips forward.
Gaze upward or back and hold for 20-30 seconds.

poses.title: Dhanurasana
description: Lie on your stomach with arms at your sides.
Bend your knees and grab your ankles with your hands.
Inhale, lift your chest and thighs off the floor.
Hold for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Nadi Shodhana
description: Sit in a comfortable position with your right thumb closing your right nostril.
Inhale deeply through your left nostril.
Close your left nostril with your ring finger and exhale through your right.

poses.title: Setu Bandhasana
description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
Press into your feet and lift your hips.
Interlace your hands under your back and hold for 15-30 seconds.

poses.title: Simhasana
description: Kneel and sit back on your heels.
Inhale deeply through your nose, then exhale through your mouth while sticking out your tongue.
Repeat for 5-10 rounds.

poses.title: Standing Side Stretch
description: Stand with feet together, arms overhead.
Interlace fingers and lean to one side.
Hold for 10-15 seconds, then switch sides.

poses.title: Salamba Bhujangasana
description: Lie on your stomach, elbows under shoulders, forearms parallel.
Lift your chest and relax your shoulders.
Hold for 30 seconds.

poses.title: Chaturanga Dandasana
description: Start in a plank position, lower your chest and thighs toward the floor.
Keep your elbows close to your body.
Hold for 15-20 seconds.

poses.title: Virabhadrasana II
description: Stand with feet wide apart, turn one foot out.
Bend the front knee at 90 degrees, arms extended parallel to the ground.
Hold for 20-30 seconds.

poses.title: Balasana
description: Kneel on the mat with your knees slightly apart and big toes touching.
Sit back on your heels.
Stretch your arms forward and lower your chest toward the floor.
Rest your forehead on the mat.
Breathe deeply, focusing on relaxing your hips, back, and shoulders.
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

poses.title: Marjaryasana-Bitilasana
description: Start in a tabletop position: hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Cow Pose: Inhale, arch your back, drop your belly, and lift your gaze upward.
Cat Pose: Exhale, round your spine, tuck your chin, and draw your belly in.
Flow between these two poses with your breath for 1-2 minutes.

poses.title: Seated Twist
description: Sit on the mat with your legs extended.
Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together.
Pull your feet closer to your pelvis, letting your knees drop toward the floor.
Hold your feet with your hands, sitting tall and straight.
Gently press your knees down with your elbows if comfortable.
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Uttanasana
description: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Inhale, lengthen your spine, and exhale as you fold forward from the hips.
Let your hands rest on the floor, ankles, or shins (depending on your flexibility).
Relax your neck and shoulders, letting your head hang heavy.
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Eka Pada Rajakapotasana
description: Start in a downward dog position.
Bring your right knee forward, placing it behind your right wrist.
Extend your left leg straight behind you with the top of the foot flat on the floor.
Keep your hips square to the front and fold your torso forward over your bent leg.
Rest your arms on the floor or extend them forward.
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute on each side.

poses.title: Utthita Parsvakonasana
description: Stand with feet wide apart, turning your right foot out and left foot slightly inward.
Bend your right knee to a 90-degree angle, keeping the knee over the ankle.
Place your right forearm on your right thigh or hand on the floor inside your right foot.
Stretch your left arm overhead, creating a straight line from your left fingertips to your left foot.
Hold for 20-30 seconds on each side.

poses.title: Utthan Pristhasana
description: Start in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and left leg extended back.
Place both hands on the inside of your right foot.
Lower your hips toward the floor and keep your back leg straight.
If comfortable, drop to your forearms.
Hold for 20-30 seconds on each side, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Ardha Matsyendrasana
description: Sit with your legs extended in front of you.
Bend your right knee and place your right foot on the outside of your left thigh.
Bend your left leg and tuck your left foot near your right hip.
Place your right hand behind you for support.
Inhale, raise your left arm, and exhale as you twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow outside your right knee.
Hold for 20-30 seconds, then repeat on the other side.

poses.title: Prasarita Padottanasana
description: Stand with your legs wide apart, feet parallel to each other.
Inhale, lengthen your spine, and exhale as you fold forward from your hips.
Place your hands on the floor, shoulder-width apart, or grab your ankles.
Relax your neck and shoulders.
Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply.

poses.title: Urdhva Dhanurasana
description: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Place your hands beside your ears with fingers pointing toward your shoulders.
Press into your hands and feet, lifting your hips and chest off the floor.
Straighten your arms and legs as much as possible, forming an arch.
Hold for 10-15 seconds, breathing deeply.
